revised_title: Crystal Structure and Hydrogen Bonding of Glucosamine Hydrochloride and Hydrobromide
tldr: The authors redetermined and refined the crystal structures of a-D-glucosamine hydrochloride and hydrobromide using modern computing methods. They found that the inter-ionic hydrogen bonding, dominated by the coordination around the NH3 groups and anions, plays a significant role in the structure. This study confirmed the original solution to the crystal structure and provided insights into the hydrogen bonding and molecular packing of these compounds.
